children.subject:
I don't believe we have a comprehensive history of the GPA thresholds since the program's inception in the early 1980's. The program has had both GPA thresholds and numerical limits on how many majors we could accommodate, but we transitioned away from student limits in favor of the more transparent GPA threshold. 

I know the GPA requirement has varied from 2.0 to 3.5+, with the late 80's and late 90's being the most competitive. Until I joined in 2012 (we had ~270 majors) our historical record was ~380 majors, more than 20 years ago. We're 1,100+ majors now and still haven't reached our highest GPA requirement--largely a testament to the department's commitment to accommodate as many students as our capacity will allow. 

After the dotcom bubble burst, numbers waned and the GPA was adjusted accordingly until it was removed altogether in 2007. Our number of CS majors has increased by nearly an order of magnitude since 2009.

+1 can someone post the history of the GPA cap from the beginning of the CS major to present?

Wasn't it really high back in the late '90s?

history.content: The 3.0 GPA threshold was implemented in Spring 2014. I'd love to hear more about your study; I might have other useful information as well. Feel free to PM!
Does anyone know when the 3.0 gpa cap was implemented for CS majors? I'm doing a study with all the grades from 1990 to the present.
history.subject: gpa cap
